item.title: Bill Cosby freed after top court overturns sexual assault conviction
item.description: The US comedian leaves jail hours after a Pennsylvania court overturned his sexual assault conviction.

item.title: Covid: NHS plans booster jab for those 50 and over before winter
item.description: The UK's vaccine committee says winter could see spikes in flu and Covid, putting pressure on the NHS.

item.title: Gap to close all 81 stores in UK and Ireland
item.description: The fashion chain says it will be online-only from the end of September.

item.title: Donald Rumsfeld: Ex-US defence secretary dies aged 88
item.description: Serving under George W Bush, he was one of the main architects of the Iraq war.

item.title: Wimbledon 2021: Andy Murray beats Oscar Otte in second-round thriller
item.description: Andy Murray reaches the Wimbledon third round after beating German qualifier Oscar Otte in another thriller finishing under the lights.

item.title: Prince Harry pays surprise visit to children's charity awards ceremony
item.description: The duke spoke to some "inspiring" children and young people with serious health conditions.

item.title: Jadon Sancho: Man Utd agree £73m fee with Borussia Dortmund for England winger
item.description: Manchester United agree a fee in principle of 85m euros (£73m) with Borussia Dortmund for England winger Jadon Sancho.

item.title: Euro 2020: Europe-based England fans offered Ukraine tickets
item.description: Fans in England are being told not to travel to the game in Italy because of strict quarantine rules.

item.title: Tim Berners-Lee sells web source code NFT for $5.4m
item.description: The sale came with a bundle of assets, including an animated video and a letter from Sir Tim.

item.title: Canada heatwave: Trudeau pays respects to dozens of victims
item.description: Dozens have died as Canada sees a new record - 49.6C (121.3F) - for the third day in a row.

item.title: Trump Organization expected to be charged over tax
item.description: The firm and its chief financial officer are set to be charged with tax-related crimes, reports say.

item.title: Ollie Bibby: Mother feels dismissed by Boris Johnson over dead son
item.description: Penny Bibby says Boris Johnson must look at changing rules so families can be together in hospital.

item.title: Green Saving Bond details revealed - except for one key factor
item.description: Savers' money will go to the government for environmental projects, but the interest to be paid remains unknown.

item.title: Royal Mail delivers letter addressed to 'woman in Cornwall shed'
item.description: The note to an author "near a village 21 miles from Land's End" finds its intended recipient.

item.title: Nick Grimshaw to leave Radio 1 after 14 years
item.description: The drivetime host says working on the station has been a "childhood dream come true".

item.title: Royal photographer: 'Diana broke the mould'
item.description: The Duke of Cambridge and the Duke of Sussex are set to unveil a statue in memory of Diana, Princess of Wales.

item.title: Brides-to-be accuse Boris Johnson of drinks reception hypocrisy
item.description: Couples express anger at a picture of Boris Johnson hosting a drinks reception.

item.title: Autistic teen struggles with changes during pandemic
item.description: Leah, 18, went into crisis during the pandemic after struggling with the changes to her life.

item.title: Raye's pain as Polydor holds release of debut album
item.description: The 23-year-old Call on Me singer says she's done "everything" the record label's asked her for.

item.title: Recovered Picasso painting slips on to the floor
item.description: The Picasso artwork Head of a Woman was being shown off during a news conference when this happened.

item.title: The Yankees' 70-year-old bat girl
item.description: Decades after she was told girls couldn't do the job, she got a chance to live her childhood dream.

item.title: Amazon launches 'child-friendly' smart speaker in UK
item.description: But privacy campaigners are warning parents the devices will also be collecting data on their youngsters.

item.title: Covid-19: Huge crowds seek vaccine as Indonesia cases soar
item.description: Thousands of people surround an Indonesian vaccine centre as the country faces a severe outbreak.

item.title: Diana statue: What next for William and Harry's relationship?
item.description: Sources say communications have been minimal - with deep upset and mistrust on both sides.

item.title: US-Canada weather: Visual guide to the heatwave
item.description: Maps, graphics and charts explaining the Canada and north-west US heatwave, with temperatures at nearly 50C.

item.title: Black Widow: Scarlett Johansson's 'rousing' Marvel film impresses most critics
item.description: But some reviewers take issue with how the Marvel superhero film handles the exploitation of women.

item.title: Hong Kong: How life has changed under China's national security law
item.description: Seven city residents tell the BBC how the national security law fundamentally changed their lives.

item.title: Wimbledon 2021: Roger Federer says grass is 'slippery under roof' after Mannarino & Williams injuries
item.description: After Serena Williams and Adrian Mannarino injure themselves on Centre Court, BBC Sport looks at why grass courts are slippery and what impact it can have.

item.title: Brexit: What's the Northern Ireland Protocol?
item.description: Why are there now some border checks between Great Britain and Northern Ireland?

item.title: Batley and Spen by-election: What's at stake for the main political parties?
item.description: The constituency will be electing a new MP on Thursday, but the parties contesting the seat have a lot riding on the result.

item.title: Mature Dunkley guides England to tense ODI win against India
item.description: Sophia Dunkley's unbeaten 73 helps England beat India by five wickets in the second ODI and take a 6-2 lead in the series.

item.title: Tottenham decide on former Wolves boss Nuno as new manager
item.description: Tottenham appoint former Wolves boss Nuno Espirito Santo as their new manager on a two-year contract.

item.title: Everton appoint ex-Liverpool boss Benitez as Ancelotti's successor
item.description: Everton appoint former Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez as Carlo Ancelotti's successor.

item.title: Defending champion Pogacar crushes field in time trial to go second behind Van der Poel
item.description: Defending champion Tadej Pogacar claims a dominant time trial victory on stage five as Mathieu van der Poel narrowly retains the yellow jersey.

item.title: Nearly 2,000 Scotland Covid cases linked to people watching Euro 2020
item.description: Most of the 1,991 cases were people who travelled to London for Scotland's game with England on 18 June.

item.title: 'Not bad for a part-time player' - Kyrgios wins epic match 9-7 in fifth set
item.description: Matteo Berrettini's fine form continues and Nick Kyrgios comes through a thrilling five sets to reach round two at Wimbledon.

item.title: Euro 2020 and Covid: How can I watch with my friends?
item.description: Covid rules are making things a bit different for Euro 2020 spectators.

item.title: What England's win means for fans
item.description: The victory over Germany at Wembley filled England fans with emotion – for a variety of reasons.

item.title: German press mourn 'bitter' end to Euros campaign
item.description: German newspapers see defeat to England as the end of an era for the national team.

item.title: Euro 2020: England 2-0 Germany - Relive Raheem Sterling & Harry Kane's goals at Wembley
item.description: Relive the best action and reactions after England's iconic Euro 2020 win over Germany.

item.title: England 2-0 Germany: Who stands between Three Lions and Euro 2020 final?
item.description: England are now favourites to reach the final of the Euros. Here's who they could face along the way.

item.title: Euro 2020: England fans celebrate after win against Germany
item.description: Some 40,000 fans inside Wembley stadium cheered as England beat Germany 2-0 in their last-16 clash.

item.title: Euro 2020: 'The stuff of dreams' - BBC pundits celebrate wildly as England score against Germany
item.description: The pundits launch into a frenzy after England score against Germany, with Rio Ferdinand claiming that the 2-0 England victory is "the stuff of dreams".

item.title: Euro 2020 quarter-final fixtures, TV guide & route to the final
item.description: All you need to know from Euro 2020, who faces who in the quarter-finals, plus when and where to watch the games.

item.title: Euro 2020 England v Germany: How Three Lions became the definitive England song
item.description: Ever-hopeful England fans have been screaming that "football's coming home" for 25 years.

item.title: How you rated England's players in win over Germany
item.description: England beat Germany in a historic last-16 Euro 2020 tie at Wembley - here is how you rated the players.

item.title: Euro 2020: England beat Germany - Gareth Southgate’s redemption on 'another day to remember'
item.description: England's 2-0 Euro 2020 win over Germany is "redemption" for manager Gareth Southgate, 25 years on from his penalty miss at Euro 96.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: Millions of people most vulnerable to Covid-19 may be offered a third vaccination in September.

item.title: Covid: Who has to self-isolate and for how long?
item.description: Growing numbers of entire classes in England are having to self-isolate because of a single positive case.

item.title: Stamp duty holiday: How is it changing?
item.description: Stamp duty rules are changing in England and Northern Ireland from 1 July.

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government is considering allowing double vaccinated adults to avoid quarantine after travel.

item.title: How many cases are in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Coronavirus: When can we stop wearing face masks or coverings?
item.description: Wearing a face covering is currently a legal requirement in many places, but rules are under review.

item.title: British Jews' fear and defiance amid record monthly anti-Semitism reports
item.description: Some 460 anti-Semitic incidents were reported to the Community Security Trust from 8 May to 7 June.

item.title: Covid quarantine hotels: Women say they were sexually harassed by guards
item.description: One woman tells the BBC a security guard employed by G4S mimed sex while they were alone in a lift.

item.title: A fake wedding, and a $250,000 scam
item.description: How a British man's dreams of a future with his Ukrainian fiancee ended in financial disaster.

item.title: Gary Allen: The killer who nearly got away with murder
item.description: Gary Allen's conviction for the murders of two women brings a 20-year quest for justice to an end.

item.title: The Lazarus heist: How North Korea almost pulled off a billion-dollar hack
item.description: In 2016 North Korean hackers planned a $1bn raid on Bangladesh's national bank and came within an inch of success. But how did they do it?
